text: if you're a creative person of any sort
you know that creating an original piece
of work can be frustrating you sit down
and your mind goes as blank as the page
sitting in front of you if that's the
case it may be worth finding inspiration
from highly creative people in this
video you'll learn three habits that
will help you produce amazing original
work you can be proud of all of this
information is based on Andrew
huberman's work whose podcast on the
topic is linked in the description box
below let's get right into the tips tip
number one enter the Flow State Flow
State also known as being in the zone
refers to a psychological state of
optimal experience and performance
characterized by complete absorption
focused concentration and deep enjoyment
in an activity Flow State typically
occurs when the challenges of a task
meets an individual's skills and
abilities in other words it's a state
between boredom when the task is too
easy and frustration when the task is
too difficult in 2011 scientists studied
the live performance of 236 music
students who played various instruments
they had the students report how
confident they felt about their playing
abilities and how much they enjoyed
playing the instrument the students who
reported that their performance was too
challenging also reported that they
didn't particularly enjoy playing as a
consequence the students did not
experience the flow States or being in
the zone the challenge was simply beyond
their current skill level the study
confirmed that in order to achieve the
flow States the activity has to be
challenging but not so much that it
causes frustration the activity also
needs to be enjoyable you're much more
likely to be in the zone when you do
something that you love doing these are
the key three components of achieving
flow optimal challenge capability and
enjoyment another key component to
achieving flow is eliminating
distractions this is why establishing
some sort of ritual where you can work
uninterrupted is critical you should
also focus on the process rather than
the end result focusing on the end
result can cause stress doubt and
anxiety which is not conduced Ive to
achieving flow instead enjoy the journey
and the satisfaction that comes from
being fully engaged in the present
moment when in flow you'll often
experience a different sense of time in
other words time will seem to fly by as
you're deeply engaged in what you're
doing so if possible try to remove the
time constraints like deadlines or other
activities you need to do next by having
enough time to focus on the task you'll
be much more likely to enter flow and
produce amazing work if you want to know
more about flow we highly recommend the
book flow by a psychologist mihi chit
set Mi High which is linked in the
description box below tip number two
have a ritual an English writer William
Somerset M famously said I write only
when inspiration strikes fortunately it
strikes every morning at 9:00 sharp
similarly Stephen King writes every
single day and has a daily goal of
writing 2,000 words he usually writes in
the morning and doesn't stop until he
reaches his goal during his writing he
doesn't allow for any distractions so he
can focus on his work this consistency
and perseverance has allowed him to
write over 60 novels over his career
most creatives have a daily routine they
rely on to get their work done in other
words they don't wait around for
inspiration instead they develop a
system to consistently work on their
craft regardless of inspiration or lack
thereof a routine that's repeated
consistently becomes a ritual Matthew
mccon has developed a ritual to prepare
for his performance it includes humming
and rhythmically beating his chest if
this sounds familiar it's because it was
actually depicted in an iconic scene
from Martin scorsese's Wolf of Wall
Street Leo DiCaprio was so intrigued by
macon's ritual he requested for this to
be incorporated into the script having a
ritual like this can help you relax and
focus which will make it easier for you
to get into the state of flow you don't
have to beat your chest like Matthew
pick something that works for you you
can visualize meditate say positive
affirmations and so on your ritual can
be as simple as making a cup of coffee
and sitting down to work work at exactly
the same time every day whatever it is
you're trying to create the only way to
do it successfully is to keep showing up
schedule a specific time of day where
you can work without interruptions even
if it's only 15 minutes if your mind
goes blank don't worry about it because
it's perfectly normal just do something
doing something badly is better than not
doing it at all you'll get better at it
the more you practice tip number three
use limitations even though human
creativity is theoretically Limitless
creating or determining boundaries for a
creative process actually enhances
creativity instead of stifling it there
needs to be rules and structure
otherwise everything would be too
chaotic here's what an award-winning
author Steven Cotler has to say on
optimizing creativity through concrete
planning and setting boundaries limits
Drive creativity the blank page is too
blank to be useful this is why in my
work one of my Cardinal rules is always
know your starts and your endings in the
early 1900s during his Cubist phase
Pablo Picasso experimented with his
paintings limiting himself to geometric
shapes and a restricted color palette as
a consequence he completely
revolutionized the art of the 20th
century similarly during his blue period
Picasso deliberately restricted his
color palette to different shades of
blue this limitation allowed him to
effectively convey specific emotions and
themes like Melancholy and introspection
Picasso's estimated net worth at the
time of his death would be between 530
million
and $1.3 billion today Picasso didn't
rely on Talent alone he added print
making stage design and even sculpture
to his Arsenal then he grew his earnings
even further with a portfolio made up of
five mansions and gold long story short
Picasso knew he couldn't put all his
eggs in one basket and he was able to
leave his family Millions to fight over
for decades you can apply this strategy
to your own portfolio with today's
sponsor Masterworks Masterworks offers
you the chance to diversify your
portfolio with million dooll
Contemporary Art including works from
Legends like Picasso as well as Basia
Monae and Banky without spending
Millions to do so Masterworks allows you
to supplement your stocks and savings
with an assessment that's historically
appreciated in times of economic crisis
they've sold $45 Million worth of arts
and distributed the net proceeds to
investors over 750,000 people have
signed up so far and while the markets
are still shaky demand is ring but my
subscribers can skip the wait list and
get started today by clicking the link
in the description using limitations in
your work will help you focus come up
with novel ideas and remove the pressure
of Endless Possibilities this will truly
unlock your creative potential and help
you produce amazing work I hope these
tips have been helpful let me know in
the comments below if you know of any
other unusual habits from your favorite
artists if you're still not sure whether
or not you should embark on your
creative Journey or if you're having
trouble staying motivated to complete
your work check out my other video on
how to increase motivation also linked
in the description box below besides
that guys stay tuned
